website_summaries.verdict: A good tasting, more affordable vegan protein powder that can be used for shakes and in baking.
pros: 24 grams of complete, organic, plant based protein sourced from a blend of Organic Pea, Organic Rice proteins
Better flavor than many other vegan powders and blends easily
cons: Not as much protein per serving as some other brands

website_summaries.verdict: If you want a certified organic plant-based protein powder, this is a solid choice that won't break the bank.
pros: Provides 24g protein per serving, plus 100% of your RDA of vitamin C and a good amount of B12
Contains a complete amino acid profile, which helps with muscle recovery
Easy to mix and tends to come out lump-free
cons: Not thick enough for some users

customer_reviews.title: Happy to see ON include a plant based option.
customer_reviews.text: I have tried a lot of plant based protein powders in my days as a devoted vegan. Much to my surprise, this Optimum Nutrition plant based protein actually had a pretty good taste to it. Love this stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Chet U.

customer_reviews.title: Plant-based review...a big nope.
customer_reviews.text: The Plant-Chocolate flavor was absolutely disgusting! I have been regularly purchasing protein powders for more than a decade and have tried quite a variety of brands and flavors. I recently decided to quest for a good plant-based protein...this was not it. The flavor is off and consistency is chalky and gritty. While I love ON in general, steer away for the plant-based.
customer_reviews.author: Elle Rae

customer_reviews.title: Why so much stevia??? or better yet, why any stevia?
customer_reviews.text: Your product description did not mention that it contains stevia prominently enough. I do not like the taste of stevia and you have way too much in this powder. I work in food product development. Stevia only works with a very light touch especially for people like me who are sensitive to the taste. Why don't you market the same product with no sweetener of any type and no vanilla flavor?
customer_reviews.author: Robert Bloom

customer_reviews.title: Stevia is overwhelming. Yuck!
customer_reviews.text: Love that it's vegan and organic, but what good does that do if you can't choke it down? It would actually be fine if it wasn't sooo sweet! It's not a good sweet either. Just weird... Adding a banana is out of the question! The sweetness is just too much and so disgusting! I've reduced the amount I use to a quarter scoop, and it's still too much. It's got to be the Stevia. Just awful! I bought the chocolate flavor. I haven't even used a full scoop, and I have no idea what I'm going to do with the rest. Too expensive to just throw on the trash! 😢
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Sweetened With Stevia, Meh
customer_reviews.text: So I was super excited about this product until I actually used it and discovered it uses Stevia as the sweetner. While I know Stevia is a 'supposedly' healthier alternative to sugar, I absolutely hate the taste (despite trying it on numerous occasions in different foods/drinks) and actually think it is way sweeter than sugar with a very strange aftertaste. No sir, I don't like it. I wish the main product description had listed that it was sweetened with Stevia as I think this is an important piece of information and greatly impacts the flavor profile of the product (and I just would have stuck with my normal protein powder).
customer_reviews.author: JRooks

customer_reviews.title: Awful taste & texture - really bummed.
customer_reviews.text: I can't remember the last time Ieft a negative review on something. I will start by saying I typically love Optimum Nutrition products for flavor, results, and price point. But this particular plant based protein powder tastes AWFUL and after shaking for several minutes in my blender bottle, still has chunks and horrible texture. The chalky, chemical-like taste is bad enough I won't chug it to get my money's worth. I'm debating on trying other plant-based powders or giving up and going back to the ON Cookies & Cream Whey. It was always perfect 🤷‍♀️
customer_reviews.author: Jaria

customer_reviews.title: I initially did not like it but now I do
customer_reviews.text: This initially tasted terrible when I mixed it with orange juice . I felt like i drank a scented candle. Made me nauseated and I couldn't finish my shake. I felt like i was drowning in vanilla flavor. I still feel sick to my stomach thinking about it. However, when mixed with soymilk it was a pleasant flavor. I now drink orange juice separately for quick carbs and drink this powder exclusively with soymilk.
customer_reviews.author: Leonid Klichinsky

customer_reviews.title: This is a HARD pass
customer_reviews.text: I have to admit, I was not a fan of this. After 3 tries of using this protein I just couldn’t get past the chalkiness. After two weeks, when I opened the container, it smelled rancid, or spoiled. Like it went bad. Maybe I received a product that was almost expired? I don’t know, but either way, I did not like the taste, the fact that it did not blend well and it was too chalky. I am going to pass on this
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Mahan

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Been using this vegan protein powder for about 6 months now and I love it. Vanilla flavor is good. Not too plain or sweet. Really like this product because The previous protein powder I used (meat based) always made me feel heavy and gave me bad gas... Although this protein powder is way more expensive than my previous one, it’s worth it to me. Much cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: sarah

customer_reviews.title: i liked it enough that i bought more of it
customer_reviews.text: mixes pretty well with spoon. slightly chalky, but very palatable. i like the taste; i mix it with vanilla flavored unsweetened almond milk. no bad aftertaste. after i finished this product, i tried MRM brand chocolate based on recommendation from Bodybuilding.com and cheaper per pound than ON brand; the flavor wasn't bad, but mixing was poor with a spoon and VERY nasty aftertaste so i only tried it only once - a waste of money. i immediately bought more ON plant powder, vanilla and chocolate (haven't tried this flavor). this ON product may be a little more expensive but it is definitely drinkable.
customer_reviews.author: OpenMind

customer_reviews.title: Quality Whey Alternative
customer_reviews.text: Solid protein powder. I had to switch from whey powder due to lactose intolerance and this product meets my needs nutritionally. The taste and consistency do however leave a bit to be desired. It’s a little heavy on the Stevia and you can definitely tell. Consistency isn’t as smooth as I’d like (using blender bottle) but it’s drinkable. Some more flavor variety would be nice - I feel like a fruit flavor might gel a little better with the sweetener used. That said overall it’s a pretty good product if you are avoiding whey. I don’t exactly look forward to my protein shake the way I did while using ON’s whey powder, but it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew C.

customer_reviews.title: This is the worst tasting vegan protein powder I've had so far
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst tasting vegan protein powder I've had so far, and I've tried at least 5 or 6 now. It's also fairly expensive when it comes to vegan protein powders, and there's less content in it than the others I've purchased. The chocolate flavor is very very subtle, so all you taste are the, albeit, healthy vegan protein powders, and stevia. I'll drink it, but I will not repurchase, and I would not recommend it, especially if this is the first vegan protein powder you try.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Optimum Nutrition great at both Whey and Plant-Based Protein
customer_reviews.text: Over the last three months I went on a plant-based protein powder spree, and Optimum Nutrition came out ahead of the pack. Great flavor, value, and texture. Among the contenders: Nuzest, Plant Works, Vegansmart, SImple Sprout Living, Sunwarrior Coffee (avoid), Epic Protein, Garden of Life (burn this immediately). The Optimum Nutrition chocolate also clocks in with the highest protein / serving (24g), although it also does have a relatively higher calorie count (150 cal). Still, it is one of the few powders that I didn't dread drinking everyday and I'm on my third jar. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Xu

customer_reviews.title: Not bad flavor but
customer_reviews.text: SO the flavor really is not that bad. LIttle chalky but i have had worse vegan shakes. A little too expensive and to be picky it is really messy process. The spoon provided has some sort of static issue where everytime you take a scoop the powder stick to the outside of it and gets all over when putting in your blender. I know that is really picky but i really didn't have that with other powders. If they lowered the price i would buy more.
customer_reviews.author: Bingo Johnny

customer_reviews.title: Horrible taste
customer_reviews.text: I drink about 4 protein shakes a day, mostly from Optimum Nutritions Hydrowhey. I thought I’d mix up my shake intake with a plant based option. The taste is disgusting. I forced one serving down, and I will toss the rest. It is the worst tasting protein shake I’ve had in at least 10 years. I thought a plant based option might add good variety, but I can’t even find any health benefits. I’m sticking to Hydrowhey and other shakes.
customer_reviews.author: ec2005

customer_reviews.title: Clumpy.
customer_reviews.text: Very clumpy, I used this with a blender, and my shakes were a solid mass, you can't drink it. Taste is not great, but pretty neutral. I give it one star, because I'll likely throw it away.
customer_reviews.author: Michael K

customer_reviews.title: Not unflavored
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to put into my oatmeal in the mornings, based on price and ingredients. Though I was hesitant since it lists pomegranate in the ingredients, I decided to try it. Even after mixing it salt and pepper and dukkah and parmesan, I can still taste the powder. I have also mixed it with oatmeal and kimchi, and I can still taste the flavor. I would not consider this unflavored. Otherwise, the product is fine. I'll be putting this in smoothies instead of savory dishes.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Wong

customer_reviews.title: Great taste
customer_reviews.text: I use this product as a breakfast replacement. I usually take before going to work about 6:00ish through 7:00 am, and it keeps me full until around 11ish; so basically a little before my lunchtime starts approaching. I mix my powder with Almond or Soy milk. I decided to buy vanilla flavor and it tastes good. My only issue is it tastes kind of chalky if you do not shake it very well. I would definitely purchase again and try the Strawberry flavor this time! I also tried another brand of protein powder Nature Bounty Optimal Solution and compared to this brand, Nature Bounty does taste better.
customer_reviews.author: Aliciasapphire

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT USE THIS! CAUSES SEVERE ILLNESS
customer_reviews.text: Do not use unless you like being very sick!! I have been using protein shakes for quite some time. I tried this one and I had a very bad reaction to something, either the shake or something else. I had severe vomiting and D. I tried it again a few weeks later, and hadn’t had anything else that day. Only this time I was so ill I almost called 911. Ao obviously this product causes this illness. Again, severe vomiting, this time with blood and D. I was shaking, in so much pain and almost hallucinating. This was the most sick I have ever felt, almost like I was poisoned, different than food poisoning. Stay far away from this!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to whey powders
customer_reviews.text: So I’m not vegan or even vegetarian but i’ve made it a point to reduce my animal product use. I finished my normal chocolate ON protein powder and decided to give this a go. I love how creamy it is and the consistency overall. I had to shake my blender bottle more than usual but it’s worth it to get that creamy consistency. One scoop of the plant made a bigger shake than the original and has much more flavor. my only complaint would be that you can definitely taste stevia and while I don’t mind the flavor, i’d prefer something more subtle. Definitely would recommend for the future though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: so good
customer_reviews.text: Man, this stuff is really good. I used to love protein shakes, but now I'm completely spoiled: I can only drink this one. The chocolate flavor has a lot of... flavor---which is cool because you can use it to hydrate. I usually break up 1 serving into quarters and just drink 4 bottles of mighty good tasting chocolate protein shake. I think ON really hit a home-run with this one.
customer_reviews.author: John R Camden

customer_reviews.title: Plant protein is what's up!
customer_reviews.text: Decided to change things up from the whey protein I usually got, and it was the right call! This plant protein is where it's at, easy on the stomach and it mixes well into liquid with just a spoon (and blends, obviously)... The flavor is great in a smoothie, subtle, faintly cinnamony and not too artificially sweet, but I'd love to see an unflavored variety (the one thing I liked about my whey powder). I'm on my second can of this and I intend to keep coming back for more!
customer_reviews.author: Michael C

customer_reviews.title: Terrible chemical taste!
customer_reviews.text: Had been using their whey product but want to go plant based. There was no "chocolate" taste, only a vile chemical taste. I used only a slightly rounded tablespoon in a glass of almond milk and drank no more than 4-5 sips before I dumped the contents down the sink. The company's standard response of "plant-based tastes different than whey products" doesn't cut it. I could take "different". I can't take "terrible". Ugh!! Returned the bottle the next day.
customer_reviews.author: Young Senior Gal

customer_reviews.title: Not good flavor 🤮🤢🧐
customer_reviews.text: Omgoodness.. tastes aweful... it says tasteless...lol I purchased for me elderly client. She doesnt like the tsste or texture either. I tried making jello with it, smoothies, and put in liquids... always seperates and has a chalky taste..ver disapointing. This wasnt cheap...
customer_reviews.author: tameka111

customer_reviews.title: Can't get past the flavor :(
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes, despite reading mixed reviews about the flavor, but it really is gross. I mixed it with my usual smoothie ingredients: almond milk, frozen banana, frozen pineapple, and spinach. It ruined the flavor. I would give it one star, but I liked the fact that it has zero cholesterol and other great ingredients. I would not recommend this. Save your money. To the trash this will go ☹️
customer_reviews.author: Shawesome

customer_reviews.title: tried to switch from Whey
customer_reviews.text: Ive been using optimum double chocolate whey powder for morning smoothies every day and felt like it might be giving me upset stomach. I switched to the plant protein also in chocolate but the texture and taste is unbearable for me. Even when mixed with berries and almond milk, even peanut butter. I cannot drink this powder. I am sorry if you HAVE to use plant based protein powder due to medical reasons. I think I will stick to the whey protein.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good with a mild difference
customer_reviews.text: Not chalky, not gritty, and dissolves/mixes well. It tastes good, with a mild pea after taste. The after taste is not bad at all, mild, just a little different. The ingredients are high quality. This will be my new go-to plant-based protein powder for after workouts.
customer_reviews.author: LCG

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product if you're looking for plant based protein shake. Did alot of research on plant based protein shakes due to I wanted to get away from the bloated situation I get from whey protein. This product always came up as one of the top plant based protein shakes. Don't really look for a great taste in a protein shake because let's be honest protein shakes aren't the best tasting things in the world. I was really surprised at how good this shake actually tastes considering it's plant based. This works great for me as the heat of the middle east has a particular way of convincing ppl not to eat during the scorching hot days.
customer_reviews.author: Dfridie

customer_reviews.title: The worst tasting protein ever!
customer_reviews.text: Worst tasting protein ever! I love other ON products but this organic chocolate plant protein is terrible. It was really clumpy, as well. Requires more powder than whey protein so it takes a lot more liquid to dissolve it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Tyler

customer_reviews.title: High quality but inferior than animal whey
customer_reviews.text: Product tastes amazing! Won't leave ant bloating sensation. However, I did not notice any more muscle gain. I kept my fitness routine on point and have noticed more gains with animal derived whey rather than plant whey. I can't speak for everyone but thats my experience
customer_reviews.author: Shopper2O

customer_reviews.title: Finally a plant protein that taste good.
customer_reviews.text: Tastes so good! Good ingredients... ON does it again. I'm a fan of most of their products. Sooo glad to finally find this - I e been thru so many other horrible tasting products (SunWarror, Orgain, Growing Naturals... just to name a few). I had come to the conclusion that plant protein just can't taste as good as Whey or Milk protein. I'm grateful it isn't so!
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Birthday cake powder
customer_reviews.text: This is very sweet. It has a birthday cake flavor I believe. The flavor is very strong and hard to mix in other things without overpowering.
customer_reviews.author: John Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Great tasting/little pricey
customer_reviews.text: Best plant based protein powder I've ever used. I use to purchase Vega protein powder but it was very chalky tasting imo. The ON powder is a lot thinner when blended. I also like the flavor! I gave this a 4 star mainly bc it's a little pricey. You get 20ish servings while some other brands will last for about a month.
customer_reviews.author: vonvon

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't stomach it
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this. It blended very smoothly and easily. I saw some reviews saying it was great and some saying it was awful, and in general I have pretty low standards for what I'll eat without complaining. I couldn't do it with this stuff though. I had maybe 1/3 of the glass that I mixed up and had to dump the rest. Obviously this comes down to personal taste, but this was not a winner for my palette.
customer_reviews.author: David Sharp

customer_reviews.title: Great for plant-based
customer_reviews.text: For a plant-based protein, this is pretty good. I've been a fan of Optimum Nutrition products for years, so I was excited to try this once I moved to a plant-based diet. It blends pretty well and the flavor is manageable. I've tried several plant-based proteins and this is the only one that doesn't make me gag.
customer_reviews.author: AP

customer_reviews.title: Tastes good and blends well
customer_reviews.text: Optimum has been making protein powder for years and I was so happy to find a plant protein made by a company that knows what they are doing! Tastes pretty good and blends well into smoothies. I use it frequently in the Body Love smoothie recipes and it’s great. No too sweet which is nice since many protein powders and drinks are obnoxiously sweet even without added sweetener.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Too Sweet!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am a big fan of the Gold Standard 100% Whey Protein Chocolate powder and have purchased it for years, but I wanted to try this alternative plant based version. Very disappointing! The flavor is so sweet-tasting that even adding 1/3 of a scoop to my veggie smoothie ruins the taste. I can't stomach an entire scoop in water or almond milk. Even though there are no artificial sweeteners, it tastes like drinking a packet of sweet n' low or equal. I threw it away! Going back to the original version.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Downs

customer_reviews.title: Strong Stevia Flavor
customer_reviews.text: The stevia flavor in this protein powder is so powerful I literally cannot taste the chocolate or fruit I add to my protein shakes. I will be going back to the Chocolate Vega Sport protein powder once I have gone through this. Vega still has the best taste from what I have tried.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Horrible taste. I’ve tried using it with many different recipes & it just completely ruins the smoothie
customer_reviews.author: Natasha

customer_reviews.title: Great for a CLEAN protein powder
customer_reviews.text: Regular whey protein was giving me crazy acne. THIS product is the best substitute for DAIRY FREE protein. I take this after my aggressive/non aggressive workouts, and I feel ZERO soreness the next day. When i dont take it, i feel the difference. I havent used it with just almond/oat milk, but it's wonderful with my smoothies. I even add it to my banana muffins as a healthy breakfast. I use the Vanilla protein, it's wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: Jisha Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Odd smell
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the plant-based vanilla protein powder. From the get-go, the flavor was not very good, it tastes as if it went bad. It mixes relatively poorly and settles. The worst part, is if you leave it for anywhere upwards of half an hour, the smell is unbearable. I've bought plant-based powder before and I don't seem to remember having this sort of issue. Looking at other reviews, it seems to stem from the sweetener is used. All in all, find another plant-based powder.
customer_reviews.author: Phil D

customer_reviews.title: Delicious
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried so many vegan protein powders and this is the only one I reorder. I’ve only tried chocolate so far and I’m hoping they have a vanilla one that’s just as good. This is the only one I actually enjoy drinking just mixed with a plant-milk and I don’t have to try to mask in a smoothie. Smoothie recipe: 1 frozen banana, 5 cubes of ice, 1 scoop of this powder, 3 TBSP peanut butter, 1 scoop fiber powder, 1 TBSP cocoa powder, plant milk to desired consistency = it’ll blow you away, I have it almost daily
customer_reviews.author: Karen Dzekunskas

customer_reviews.title: SEAL WAS OPENED!
customer_reviews.text: the seal came opened...it's against the law to have a seal opened...this is highly questionable now and will be asking for my money back. Don't want to contaminate my body with a open seal that anyone could've put stuff inside. Disappointed coming from a top company.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good
customer_reviews.text: Blends very well with water, comes out smooth with no clumps. mixed it with non-dairy milk once and it was too thick for my liking. Its sweet (I purchased chocolate) compared to other vegan powders I've tried, this is the best as far as flavor & mixing, Ive recommended this brand to others - would buy again
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: tastes great and mixes well with spoon
customer_reviews.text: Tastes great and mixes perfectly with just a spoon. watch the documentary "what's with wheat?" to know why i'm switching to plant-based protein powder from whey- and casein-protein powder. i'm also taking BCAA capsules to supplement this powder.
customer_reviews.author: OpenMind

customer_reviews.title: Not smooth
customer_reviews.text: Not my most favorite protein powder. I do like how you just need one scoop. But it’s kind of gritty and not as smooth as other brands I’ve tried. At times I feel like it can make me nauseous. It could work better for you but probably won’t buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Mia Marie

customer_reviews.title: One of the best for plant proteins
customer_reviews.text: I've tried quite a few plant proteins and this has to be runner up. I think garden of life is better but I have not compared ingredients, just going off of taste. I think you might get more of your moneys worth with the optimum brand. Like I said I haven't done my research, guestamating..
customer_reviews.author: ADVENTURE CLUB

customer_reviews.title: Way Too Sweet
customer_reviews.text: I'm just getting back in to using protein powders and this is about the 5th powder I've tried in recent months. I was impressed by the ingredients and that it is vegan. The not so impressive stuff is 1) the flavor. It might as well be vanilla. And 2) it is way too sweet!!! And that Stevia aftertaste! Yuck! If you are trying this powder, I recommend not adding anything sweet to it, like a banana.
customer_reviews.author: JKBoxerGirl

customer_reviews.title: Pure ingredients, good flavor, good nutrition
customer_reviews.text: Taste great. No one likes chalky protein powders but this is the first time I've ever enjoyed the chalky texture of this stuff. It has a really great flavor (vanilla). I drink it with half almond milk and half water. It has a full daily value of vitamin C and 25% daily of vegan b12. I'm not vegan but this stuff is pretty damn good. The only bad part isnt the best at blending, but if you just swirl a knife on the bottom of your blender bottle for 10 seconds all is well. You also do pay the price $ for ingredient quality which is fairly steep but not crazy.
customer_reviews.author: Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Tastes too bad
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrible tasting product. I really hoped for something better from Optimum Nutrition because their other products are so tasty. I tried mixing it with all kind of delicious things to make it edible and it just ruined everything it touched. I’m sad because I really wanted to love it. It’s not cheap but I simply can’t choke it down.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Carnehl

customer_reviews.title: Say YES to a PLANT Protein!!!
customer_reviews.text: My whole life my favorite protein has easily been Optimum Nutrition's 100% whey gold standard. After going Vegan and struggling to find a good plant based protein, I finally found out that Optimum Nutrition makes 100% PLANT!!! I love it; I've found my new protein :)
customer_reviews.author: Steven Ramos

customer_reviews.title: No
customer_reviews.text: This was my second venture into plant-based protein and I honestly hated this one more than Vega. I tried it twice. Once on it’s own and once with peanut butter powder. Awful. So bad I gave it away.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Very good shake
customer_reviews.text: I recently started to get back into shape so I needed a protein powder. I read a review where this one was good so I purchased it. This is my second container. It mixes well and has a decent flavor overall. The only real complaint that I have is it isn't the best tasting-although it is very good. I would say a 7-8 out of 10 on flavor. I mix mine with a little bit of the PB2 which gives it a touch more protein and also enhances the flavor just a little.
customer_reviews.author: John May

customer_reviews.title: Will not buy again; will try to give it away
customer_reviews.text: I don't have much experience with protein powders. I tried a whey and had diarrhea so I decided to give this kind a try instead. I dislike the texture most of all, too smooth and thick for me. I also dislike the flavor. I kept adding stuff until the flavor was OK, but still not great. I have a friend who might like it, so I will pass it on but I don't know whether to try another brand or give up and eat eggs!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Lee Clark

customer_reviews.title: I like treats, but way to sweet!
customer_reviews.text: Ive tried blending this plain, or with banana, I even tried adding cocoa powder to cut the sweetness and make it tastes somewhat like chocolate(didn't work). It is so unbelievably sweet, and the after taste of stevia is awful. The only thing resembling chocolate is the color (sort of). I liked the way it kept me full, but first you have to be able to choke it down.
customer_reviews.author: Silver

customer_reviews.title: The berry is better
customer_reviews.text: I love the berry plant based flavor, so I tried the plant based chocolate. The flavor of is sweet, but not very chocolatey, but a little cacao powder improves it. I have noticed that the chocolate flavor doesn’t mix up as well as the berry. It’s not my favorite, but I’ll buy it again for variety.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Best value for Plant based protein
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure why this protein did not come up as a top result of my amazon search. As a result, I tried Vega and Orgain before stumbling on this. By far, this has the best price and taste. I stock up on vanilla and chocolate flavors. I use vanilla powder with fruit and almond milk. I like to use chocolate powder with peanut butter, banana, and almond milk.
customer_reviews.author: CS

customer_reviews.title: Repeat customer.
customer_reviews.text: This has been the third time buying this. The taste is not for everyone pea protien tends to have a chalky aftertaste but I wouldn't say its terrible. Mix it with a banana or/and peanut butter and you are good to go. Kinda wish the plant based had a bigger variety of flavors, the whey has alot more options . But nonetheless id buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Karl

customer_reviews.title: Good with almond milk
customer_reviews.text: Edit: Vanilla is pretty terrible. Chocolate is okay. Vegetable based protein powder will always have its pros and cons. That being said, this has a fairly pleasant taste. I recommend blending it with almond milk.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Tastes better than most vegan chocolate protein powders
customer_reviews.text: It's not a chunky mess. It blends well and tastes good. Not as rich as the whey, but great if you're vegan or lactose intolerant.
customer_reviews.author: Welwood

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product However....
customer_reviews.text: I think Optimum Nutrition makes excellent products however the stevia in is a little bit too much for me. Other than that, it is a great plant based protein.
customer_reviews.author: PJon

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to like it..
customer_reviews.text: I've been trying different plant-based protein powders to find one that was both affordable and tastes good. I wanted to love this protein because of the price, but I bought the chocolate and I think it's awful. It has a strong sweetner/chemical taste and does not blend well. My advice is spend a few more bucks and get Vega sport.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Too chalky and overpowering taste
customer_reviews.text: I love ON products and I was really looking forward to trying this plant based protein, but unfortunately this protein powder was too hard to choke down. Very chalky texture and the flavor was overpowering.
customer_reviews.author: Areli

customer_reviews.title: Terrible taste by itself, I can't finish this.
customer_reviews.text: The "chocolate" protein powder that I've ordered is an absolutely terrible taste on its own. I've tried adding both milk and water and both have a equally disgusting taste. If you do not mix anything to this powder, it tastes very similar to drinking all-purpose flower! Where I am, I do not have regular access to a blender and thus I cannot add something to mask its abhorrent taste, so I absolutely cannot recommend this product to someone who plans on simply mixing in some milk and water and expecting a great tasting protein shake.
customer_reviews.author: supedaglup

customer_reviews.title: Vanilla: Chalky medicinal taste, doesn't mix well.
customer_reviews.text: Two stars because it has additional vitamins, B-12, Vit C. I bought the vanilla flavor and it does not mix well at all even in a blender running for about a minute. The taste is very chalky and medicinal-like. I usually like ON stuff but this one misses the mark.
customer_reviews.author: KublaiK

customer_reviews.title: It's good
customer_reviews.text: This is the best plant based protein I've tried so far. Ever since I switched to plant based, my fruit and/or veggie smoothies haven't tasted the same, but this one has the least amount of "weird" taste to it and offers a good substitute to the whey protein I used to drink. I bought vanilla. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonShopper

customer_reviews.title: Really good taste
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical at first about the flavor but once I blended with water or milk it has a really good taste.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro V

customer_reviews.title: Best Plant Based Protein Shake Powder I've Had So Far
customer_reviews.text: I've used Optimum Nutrition supplements for ten years now. Their products have always been excellent, including this one. The flavor is good, 7/10.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Android

customer_reviews.title: Best dissolving/mixing protein powder.
customer_reviews.text: I love this protein powder. Am using one scoop and adding it in my coffee (best blending/mixing power). Its soo fine - just like powered sugar....dissolves in my coffee. It fill me up - 4 to 5 hrs. I barely leave any feedback but this is just a happy product. I will definitely get it again once am done. Great price too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Plant Protein Tastes great!
customer_reviews.text: Plant Protein Tastes great! So glad Optimum got on board with Plant Protein. Tested it with just water alone and it is very drinkable. But to really make the best, add some almond milk, a banana, some creatine and small amount of Green Superfood and you have a fantastic smoothie.
customer_reviews.author: D. Long

customer_reviews.title: its good
customer_reviews.text: I think with any other vegan Protein it will have that grainy after taste. I use almond milk with it and add bananas to make it easier to drink.
customer_reviews.author: shirley campos

customer_reviews.title: It's tolerable
customer_reviews.text: As far as Vegan protein goes the taste isn't too bad. It works just as well as any whey based protein...just tastes way worse. Decent amount of protein for the serving size.
customer_reviews.author: N

customer_reviews.title: Gross
customer_reviews.text: Yuck, flavor is terrible. I was hoping from more from Optimum Nutrition
customer_reviews.author: Lizzy The Librarian

customer_reviews.title: Good price, but not tasty, and chalky
customer_reviews.text: Tbh its not terrible but the taste is quite chalky and doesnt dissolve and blend completely. There are worst options but im sure there are better tasting and blending ones! Its hard finding good tasting plant based protein that tastes good! Its affordable but i have to just chug it bcuz of the taste.
customer_reviews.author: Bre

customer_reviews.title: Taste Awful.
customer_reviews.text: I’m a huge fan of optimum nutrition’s whey protein line but the flavor of the plant based protein falls short. I can’t drink it, it’s awful!
customer_reviews.author: maze4UA

customer_reviews.title: A Good Vegan Protein Powder
customer_reviews.text: I use this as an ingredient in my morning breakfast drink. The product is light, mixes well and is VEGAN!
customer_reviews.author: Elliott A.

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: Not bad actually. I usually dont drink protein powder with just water. I make shakes with a banana or peanut butter. By itself it was okay, kind of sweet like maybe splenda. But with a banana and some peanut butter. It was actually really good for my taste. It almost smells and taste like a tamale paste.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tasty and blends well.
customer_reviews.text: The best vegan protein I have tried. Tastes great and blends well. No chalky powdery taste.
customer_reviews.author: Tom H Sziler

customer_reviews.title: Love this plant-based protein!
customer_reviews.text: It's by far the best tasting and best texture. I have tried other plant based proteins but they are chalky and too thick. This digests well and has a great simple flavor. I have it on autoship!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Priller

customer_reviews.title: Its okay
customer_reviews.text: Not amazing taste, but okay. Mixed it at first with almond milk and it was terrible. Afterwards, started to drink it with water and the taste is pretty doable and you get use to it. Haven't find an amazing non-milk protein powder so as for now, this does a quite fine job. And its healthy, which is the most important thing.
customer_reviews.author: Evelyne Diaz Araque

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: I put this protein powder in my morning coffee. Blends well and taste great. No stomach irritation either. I've been a consistent user of this product for over a year.
customer_reviews.author: Dena Squared

customer_reviews.title: Terrible taste
customer_reviews.text: I still have yet to find a good tasting plant based protein powder. If anybody knows of one, please reply here and let me know your recommendation.
customer_reviews.author: FSS

customer_reviews.title: Booo!
customer_reviews.text: Awful taste, worse to mix. Even after mixing with an electric blender it was gritty.
customer_reviews.author: Drew...

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but worth it
customer_reviews.text: This is the best vegan protein powder I’ve ever had, taste and quality wise. I ordered them with one day shipping and they arrived that same night. Will continue to buy each month!
customer_reviews.author: christine

customer_reviews.title: 👎🏼
customer_reviews.text: This is my first plant based protein powder and I am not impressed. The taste is off and it mixes poorly. The rest of this brands powders are great.
customer_reviews.author: Water o'Dim

customer_reviews.title: However I do like how much protein per scoop you get
customer_reviews.text: So the product tastes rather bland. I actually ordered a different flavor than what was sent to me so it’s possible that the chocolate (which I ordered) is more potent in flavor. Also, the container which contains the powder was barely sealed upon opening. However I do like how much protein per scoop you get.
customer_reviews.author: Elena Konovalova

customer_reviews.title: Good protein powder but it has a weird taste.
customer_reviews.text: I just tried this product for the first time and I'm not 100% satisfied with it. I tried a variety of protein powders on the market and thus far this one is one of the worst ones with it comes to taste, for me it does not taste like vanilla. Besides the taste the powder mixes well in the shaker doesn't have any after hours effects plus it seems like it has good nutritional value in it.
customer_reviews.author: Ada Szczelina

customer_reviews.title: TOO MUCH STEVIA!!!
customer_reviews.text: This product is very sweet. I was afraid of this when I purchased it. I prefer no added sweeteners so that I can control the sweetness of my protein shakes. I will gag this stuff down using as many bland additives as possible but will have to go back to a whey protein powder with no added sweeteners.
customer_reviews.author: M Kathy Reed

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Loved it the first time, but now it taste different and is more chalky. Not very happy, and pretty positive I can’t return...
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a good protein plant based powder and someone recommended this one. I bought vanilla bc I like to mix it with fruits. i really like it. not gritty and has a good amount of protein for being plant based. it is also organic which is nice. price is right too.
customer_reviews.author: Melina Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Keep coming back!
customer_reviews.text: A protein powder that I continue to repurchase! Blends great and taste great. It's actually a nice treat after a hard workout! I put one scoop into a glass of water and stir with a spoon! Super simple.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Coakley

customer_reviews.title: Tastes like dirt
customer_reviews.text: Not a good taste. Pretty grimy. Really makes me of dirt when I drink this protein. I switched to Vega Protein for my non- dairy protein powder.
customer_reviews.author: E Hero

customer_reviews.title: Great plant based protein option!!
customer_reviews.text: I decided to try this plant based protein as my body has not reacted well to whey based protein. I see some reviews saying that it has a weird taste but I disagree. I got vanilla & it tastes like vanilla protein powder. I’ve never LOVED the taste of any protein powders but this one is good! Definitely a good option for anyone wanting to try a plant based protein powder.
customer_reviews.author: Holly R.

customer_reviews.title: but I actually really love it. The flavor isn't super chocolatey - it's ...
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant about this protein powder, but I actually really love it. The flavor isn't super chocolatey - it's just perfect! I will definitely re buy and add this in my protein powder rotation.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Crosta

customer_reviews.title: Good brand and good powder
customer_reviews.text: Good flavor and decent blending ability for a plant-based protein. Best one I have used so far and this one has the least chalky flavor I have found. Much better than the last brand I tried. It’s still protein powder though, so it’s not like it is amazing tasting. But compared to similar products, it’s the best.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Stucker

customer_reviews.title: So good!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff rocks. Tastes great and mixes well into almost any smoothie. I’m a vegetarian and this is by far the best alternative to whey protein. Other brands tend to be more chunky. This stuff blends right in.
customer_reviews.author: Chris G

customer_reviews.title: The best one I have sound so far with out a lot of extra stuff I don’t want.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good plant based protein powder. It’s unflavored, so I can make my smoothie any way I want. I am not blown away by it. But it is a solid part of my smoothies! Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Beckstead

customer_reviews.title: Works ok.  Great nutrition content.
customer_reviews.text: Tastes powdery even after mixing. Pretty much the same as most protein powders, so not great but ok. Bought as a substitute for another powder that was out, but will go back to the other after using this up.
customer_reviews.author: Mutt

customer_reviews.title: Not Gritty. Tastes Great!
customer_reviews.text: Nice taste. Not too gritty. I have this with a scoop of Amazing Grass in chocolate flavor with 3/4 cup of water from the fountain in the gym and half a banana every morning after the gym as I'm walking out. So far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: MGS

customer_reviews.title: Plant-Based Protien For the Win
customer_reviews.text: My husband is using this vanilla plant-based protein and has noticed huge improvements in muscle retention since using it daily. The plant-based vanilla tastes great added to smoothies to just mixed with coconut milk.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Malen

product_meta.title: Optimum Nutrition Gold Standard 100% Plant Based Protein Powder, Vitamin C for Immune Support, Vanilla, 1.51 Pound
product_meta.description: Flavor:Vanilla| Size:1.51 Pound (Pack of 1)GOLD STANDARD 100 percent Plant Protein was made for active adults who care about what they eat and where their nutrients come from. By combining organic pea, brown rice and sacha inchi proteins, you benefit from a complete profile of essential amino acids to support muscle recovery. Along with 24 grams of protein, each serving delivers 100 percent of the Daily Value of vitamin C, provides an excellent source of vitamin B12 and includes a gluten free complex of ancient grains and pomegranate powder. Help keep your goals and your diet on track with this USDA Certified Organic, non GMO formula that's free of artificial colors, flavors and sweeteners.
feature_bullets: Complete Amino Acid Profile to support muscle recovery
24 grams of complete, organic, plant based protein sourced from a blend of Organic Pea, Organic Rice, and Organic Sacha Inchi proteins
USDA Organic & Non GMO, No artificial flavors, colors or sweeteners
Gluten free, all grain complex made with ancient grains Amaranth, Quinoa, Buckwheat, Millet and Chia

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
